item.description: [...] Electric Cars - Why to the fiddlers and the inventers produce … The car’s deep-cycle, 12-volt, lead-acid batteries are hooked up in series. They provide a total of 96 volts of current to an electric motor mounted in the reconstituted Beetle’s trunk, where its gasoline engine used to reside. … [...]

item.description: [...] Electric Cars - Why to the fiddlers and the inventers produce … Ralph Laborde bought his son’s Bradley on eBay for $5000. The car only had a few thousand miles on it and its gas-burning, air-cooled and rear-mounted engine got between 32 and 35 miles per gallon. But the goal was to switch completely … [...]
